availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
To Langle Bell Town Marshal of the town of Hopkinsville

you are Hereby commanded to Summon Louis Elb to appear before me Police Judge of Hopkinsville to answer for a violation of the ordinance passed by the Board of trustees of the Town of Hopkinsville on the 23d of June 1858 which ordinance prohibits the opening of business houses on the sabbath day and the selling of goods wares and merhcandize in Said Town & which ordinance the Said Louis Elb is charged with having violated on 3 sabbaths) to wit,, March the last sabbath in March 1865 the 1st & 2nd Sabbaths in april) to wit (the 2nd & 9th of april 1865. this process in issued at the instance of the ^Board of^ trustees of the Town of Hopkinsville. & have then & there this writ with due return upon it, given under my hand this the 10th day of april 1865
